hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Europe: Belgium: Airline Loan Shift

abstract.p: European Commission says bankrupt Sabena airlines can pass unused $111.6 billion Belgian government bridge loan to its Delta Air Transport unit (S)

block.p: Sabena, Belgium's bankrupt national airline, can pass an unused $111.6 million bridge loan from the Belgian government to its subsidiary, Delta Air Transport, the European Commission said. The loan, the commission said, is short-term rescue aid and is open to any part of Sabena as long as it is not used to finance a restructuring. The Belgian prime minister, Guy Verhofstadt, said yesterday that his government had commitments for $178.6 million in financing from 12 lenders to help the Delta unit establish itself. The Brussels bankruptcy court, however, has yet to rule on whether the subsidiary can take over Sabena's operations.
